00032 #include "nsISupports.idl"
00033 
00034 interface nsISimpleEnumerator;
00035 interface sbIMediaListView;
00036 interface sbIRemoteMediaList;
00037 
00038 /*
00039 Class: WebPlaylist
00040 
00041 The <WebPlaylist> UI object. This object controls the UI that appears at
00042 the bottom of the page. The information accessible here and operations
00043 available here correspond to the the actual UI. Selection, column modification
00044 and setting of the <MediaList> that serves as the data for the UI.
00045 
00046 Columns:
00047 A note about columns. All the columns in the UI are driven by the existance
00048 of global level properties in Songbird. There are a number of types available
00049 to the developer ( see addColumn() ). Each column must have a unique name and
00050 there are a number system default names we use to get the default set of
00051 columns. They are set when Songbird starts. When a column name is required as a
00052 parameter to a function the default names can be used provided the operation
00053 is not trying to add a column of that name. They can be passed in for the
00054 before column, or they can be hidden via hideColumn().
00055 
00056 The default columns have names of this format -
00057 (begin code)
00058  http://songbirdnest.com/data/1.0#<columnIdentifier>
00059 (end)
00060 
00061 The complete list of column names can be found in 
00062 http://publicsvn.songbirdnest.com/browser/trunk/components/property/src/sbStandardProperties.h
00063 
00064 */
00072 [scriptable, uuid(6aa00573-1aaa-4ff9-9080-fbd172669997)]
00073 interface sbIRemoteWebPlaylist : nsISupports
00074 {
00075   /*
00076   Group: WebPlaylist Properties
00077   */
00078 
00079   /*
00080   Prop: mediaList
00081 
00082   The <MediaList> associated with this <WebPlaylist> instance.
00083 
00084   Type:
00085     <MediaList>
00086   */
00087   attribute sbIRemoteMediaList mediaList;
00088 
00089   /*
00090   Prop: selection
00091 
00092   The current selection in the <WebPlaylist>.
00093 
00094   Type:
00095     Enumerator, contains <MediaItems>.
00096 
00097   Example:
00098     (start code)
00099     //Get the current webplaylist.
00100     var webPlaylist = songbird.webPlaylist;
00101     
00102 
00103     //Get the currently selected mediaitems in the webplaylist.
00104     var selectedMediaItems = webPlaylist.selection;
00105 
00106     //Go through all the selected mediaitems.
00107     
00108     //The hasMoreElements method will return true until there are
00109     //no more elements left to get using the getNext method.
00110     
00111     while(selectedMediaItems.hasMoreElements()) {
00112       var mediaItem = selectedMediaItems.getNext();
00113 
00114       //Do something with the mediaitem.
00115       ...
00116     }
00117     (end)
00118 
00119   See Also:
00120     Please see <http://www.xulplanet.com/references/xpcomref/ifaces/nsISimpleEnumerator.html> for nsISimpleEnumerator interface reference.
00121   */
00122   readonly attribute nsISimpleEnumerator selection;
00123 
00124   /*
00125   Group: WebPlaylist Methods
00126   */
00127 
00128   /*
00129   Method: setSelectionByIndex()
00130 
00131   Set the selection in the <WebPlaylist>.
00132 
00133   Prototype:
00134     setSelectionByIndex(Number index, Boolean selected)
00135 
00136   Parameters:
00137     index - Index of the item in the <WebPlaylist>. Index starts at 0.
00138     selected - Flag used for setting the selection state, may be true or false.
00139 
00140   Example:
00141     (start code)
00142     //Get the current webPlaylist.
00143     var webPlaylist = songbird.webPlaylist;
00144 
00145     //Select the first item.
00146     webPlaylist.setSelectionByIndex(0, true);
00147 
00148     //Select the third item.
00149     webPlaylist.setSelectionByIndex(2, true);
00150 
00151     //Unselect the first item.
00152     webPlaylist.setSelectionByIndex(0, false);
00153     (end)
00154   */
00155   void setSelectionByIndex(in unsigned long aIndex, in boolean aSelected);
00156 
00157   /*
00158   Method: addColumn()
00159 
00160   Add a column of data to the <WebPlaylist>. If the column already exists in
00161   the system and the hidden is false then the column will be shown before the
00162   column name passed in but no other settings will be adjusted.
00163 
00164   If you want to set the values of new columns for each track you must add
00165   the column before calling setProperty on each track. Otherwise the system
00166   will automatically add the property to the system as type text and it
00167   won't have the setting you set through this call.
00168 
00169   Prototype:
00170     addColumn(String columnType, 
00171               String columnName,  
00172               String displayName, 
00173               String buttonLabel, 
00174               String beforeColumn, 
00175               Boolean hidden, 
00176               Boolean viewable, 
00177               Boolean editable,
00178               Number nullSort,
00179               Number width)
00180 
00181   Parameters:
00182     columnType - The type of column.
00183     columnName - The name of the column.
00184     displayName - The displayed name of the column.
00185     buttonLabel - The label for a button, if of type simple/download button
00186     beforeColumn - Insert the new column before the column with this name. 
00187                    If an empty string is specified, the column is appended 
00188                    to the end of the existing columns.
00189     hidden - Hidden column by default.
00190     viewable - Column can be viewed by the user.
00191     editable - Column row cell values can be edited by the user.
00192     nullsort - The type of null sorting desired.
00193     width - The default width of the column when displayed.
00194 
00195   Column Types:
00196     text - Plain text.
00197     datetime - A time interval.
00198     uri - A URI (web address).
00199     number - A number.
00200     button - A clickable button.
00201     image - A picture.
00202     downloadbutton - A button which, when clicked, initiates a download.
00203     rating - 5 stars representing the value
00204 
00205   Null Sorting Types:
00206     0 - Null values are infinitely small.  This is the default.
00207     1 - Null values are infinitely large.
00208     2 - Null values are always first (regardless of sort direction)
00209     3 - Null values are always last
00210 
00211   Example:
00212     (start code)
00213     // add a text column to the web playlist
00214     songbird.webPlaylist.addColumn( "text",
00215                                     "http://domain.com/colname1",  // make sure it's unique
00216                                     "column heading goes here",
00217                                     "", // nothing needed for type text
00218                                     "", // add at the end
00219                                     false, // not hidden
00220                                     true, // can be viewed
00221                                     false, // read-only
00222                                     0,
00223                                     150); // pixels
00224     (end)
00225 
00226   See Also:
00227     <showColumn()>
00228     <showColumnBefore()>
00229     <hideColumn()>
00230   */
00231   void addColumn( in AString aColumnType,
00232                   in AString aColumnName,
00233                   in AString aDisplayName,
00234                   in AString aButtonLabel,
00235                   in AString aBeforeColumnName,
00236                   in boolean aHidden,
00237                   in boolean aUserViewable,
00238                   in boolean aUserEditable,
00239                   in unsigned long aNullSort,
00240                   in unsigned long aWidth );
00241 
00242   /*
00243   Method: showColumnBefore()
00244 
00245   Show a column before another column. This enables you to move
00246   columns around visually as well as specify where you might want your own
00247   column to be shown.
00248 
00249   Prototype:
00250     showColumnBefore(String columnName, String beforeColumn)
00251 
00252   Parameters:
00253     columnName - The name of column to move.
00254     beforeColumn - Show the column with columnName 
00255                    before the column with beforeColumn.
00256 
00257   Example:
00258     (start code)
00259     (end)
00260 
00261   See Also:
00262     <addColumn()>
00263     <showColumn()>
00264     <hideColumn()>
00265   */
00266   void showColumnBefore( in AString aColumnName,
00267                          in AString aBeforeColumnName );
00268 };
